text: Montbard is a commune and subprefecture of the Côte-d'Or department in the Bourgogne-Franche-Comté region in eastern France. It is also the capital of the arrondissement of Montbard and of the canton of Montbard. ==Geography== The commune of Montbard has an area of , and its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . Distance from Montbard to other cities Dijon Paris Reims Strasbourg Lyon Marseille Nice Montbard and its neighboring communes The commune of Montbard is surrounded by the communes: The city of Montbard is to the northwest of the city of Dijon, capital of the department, and in the valley of the Brenne river. ===Climate=== The climate of Montbard is Marine West Coast Climate (Köppen climate classification: Cfb), with mild winters and warm summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Montbard are known, in French, as Montbardois (women: Montbardoises). With a population of 5,350, Montbard has a population density of inhabitants/km2.
